value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">xxx</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">29</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Anonymity was a <quote source="#" rend="inline">great possession</quote>. It gave the early</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">writing a general nature. It gave us the 
            <choice>
              <sic>ballds</sic>
              <corr>ballads</corr>
            </choice>; it</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">gave us the songs. It allowed us to know nothing of the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">mans name. <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-anon" key="Anon">Anon</rs> had great privileges. He is not</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">resopnsible. He is not self conscious. He can borrow.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">He can repeat. He can say what 
            <choice>
              <sic>very</sic>
              <corr>every</corr>
            </choice> one feels.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">No one asks that he shall stamp his own name on his work.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">He keeps at a distance from the present moment.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Anon the lyric poet repeats over and over again</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">that flowers fade; that death is the 
            <choice>
              <sic>ned</sic>
              <corr>end</corr>
            </choice>. He is never</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">tired of celebrating red roses and white breasts.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The anonymous playwright has like the singer this nameless</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">vitality, 
            <choice>
              <sic>somwthing</sic>
              <corr>something</corr>
            </choice> drawn from the crowd in the penny</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">seats and not 
            <choice>
              <sic>yey</sic>
              <corr>yet</corr>
            </choice> dead in ourselves. For we too become</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">anonymous 
            <choice>
              <sic>nand</sic>
              <corr>and</corr>
            </choice> forget something that we have learnt</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">in reading the 
            <choice>
              <sic>p;ays</sic>
              <corr>plays</corr>
            </choice> that no one has 
            <choice>
              <sic>troub led</sic>
              <corr>troubled</corr>
            </choice> to set a</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">name to.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">But at some point there comes a break when anonymity</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">withdraws. It comes presumably when the 
            <choice>
              <sic>playwrgight</sic>
              <corr>playwright</corr>
            </choice> has</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>abosrbed</sic>
              <corr>absorbed</corr>
            </choice> the 
            <choice>
              <sic>contrbution</sic>
              <corr>contribution</corr>
            </choice> of the audience; and returns it</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">to them in a single figure <del hand="ms">which is individual</del>. There is a</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">moment in <del>play 
            <choice>
              <sic>aft</sic>
              <corr>after</corr>
            </choice> play</del> when the audience is no longer</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">master of the playwright; yet is not separate from him.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">A common life still unites them, but the playwright becomes</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">increasingly diminant. This separation comes fitfully.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Now we say He is speaking our woxmxmxx thoughts.</l>

<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" source="#" rend="inline">
            <l>
              <choice>
                <sic>NoO</sic>
                <corr>O</corr>
              </choice> God, O God that it were possible</l>
            <l>To undo 
              <choice>
                <sic>thin s</sic>
                <corr>things</corr>
              </choice> done; to call back yesterday.</l>
          </quote>
